Running rSpec from TextMate

By Ted Benson on Jan 13, 2008

Just a quick tip for installing the rSpec bundle for TextMate: it is important that the bundle that you install is synced with the version of rSpec that you are actually running on your machine / in your project. Otherwise you will get a bunch of Ruby errors.

Close TextMate, open up a shell, and go to the bundles directory for your installation, which is probably something like this:

/Users/USER/Library/Application Support/TextMate/Pristine Copy/Bundles/

And then run the following code to pull down the latest (you may want to use a particular tag) from their repo:

svn export http://rspec.rubyforge.org/svn/trunk/RSpec.tmbundle/

Then you can enjoy nice testing by pressing Command-R from within one of your spec files: (IMAGE REMOVED - My blog was hacked and I lost data)
